description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with use of red ink for commented text. European paper with watermark ("FF. Palazzuoli"). Collation: Paper, fol. i, 386, i ; i (free endpaper) 1-38¹⁰ 39⁶ i (free endpaper) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "150/140". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "1527". Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Thursday 17 Jumādá al-Thānī 1281 [Nov. 17, 1864] (fol. 384b). Incipit: الحمد هو الوصف بالجميل الاختياري سواء تعلق بالفضايل او بالفواضل Explicit: بقى سهمان للام وسهم للعم فينقسم باقى المال بينهما اثلاثا والله تعالى اعلم تم الكتاب بعون الوهاب وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل نعم المولى ونعم النصير ولا حول ولا قوة الا بالله العلى العظيم وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد خاتم الانبيا والمرسلين وعلى اله وصحبه اجمعين والحمد لله رب العالمين امين
author: Muʻīn al-Dīn Farāhī, -1501 or 1502
abstract: Commentary on Kanz al-daqāʼiq, a treatise on Islamic law according to the Ḥanafī school by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad al-Nasafī (d. 710/1310).
alternative: حاشيه منلا مسكين على كنز الدقائق
extent: i, 386, i leaves: paper ; 202 x 152 (150 x 85) mm. bound to 205 x 165 mm.
title: Sharḥ Munlā Miskīn ʻalá matn Kanz al-daqāʼiq raḥimahu Allāh āmīn.
provenance: From the books of ʻAbd al-Majīd al-Bāqī(?) (fol. 1a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: معين الدين فراهي
subject: Nasafī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad, -1310—Kanz al-daqāʼiq.
binding note: Quarter bound with flap, in marbled paper and red leather.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
